title: Gift Giving

metadata.author: Nina Evason
metadata.note: All research and editorial content is developed and curated by Mosaica.

description: Gift-giving in Malaysia reflects values of respect, modesty, and social reciprocity, with attention to cultural sensitivity and symbolic meanings.

guidelines.text: Gifts are given and received using both hands as a sign of respect.
Recipients may initially refuse a gift before accepting it, which is considered polite and shows modesty.
Avoid giving overly expensive or grand gifts, as recipients may feel uncomfortable if they cannot reciprocate.
Gifts should not be opened immediately or in front of the giver to prevent loss of face.
Money should generally be avoided as a gift. If given, it should be in an even amount.
Knives or scissors should not be given as gifts, as they symbolise the severing of relationships.
